Title: NASM: Multiple Vulnerabilities
Synopsis: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in NASM, the worst of which could lead to arbitrary code execution.

Background.Text: NASM is a 80x86 assembler that has been created for portability and modularity. NASM supports Pentium, P6, SSE MMX, and 3DNow extensions. It also supports a wide range of objects formats (ELF, a.out, COFF, etc), and has its own disassembler.

Description.Text: Multiple vulnerabilities have been discovered in NASM. Please review the CVE identifiers referenced below for details.

Impact.Text: Please review the referenced CVE identifiers for details.

Workaround.Text: There is no known workaround at this time.

P.Text: All NASM users should upgrade to the latest version:
